verbose_text: Indeed, when fear memory is retrieved by re-exposure to the CS, the retrieved memory returns to a labile state (i.e., is destabilized), as is the case with short-term memory, and is restored via the reconsolidation process that requires the similar gene expression program such as transcription factor cAMP responsive element binding protein (CREB)-mediated transcription with consolidation [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR].
